span.span: Our School policy is to mirror the Clayton County Public Schools ‘closing and delayed opening announcements’ as it pertains to weather related emergency events. Please tune into your local TV and Radio media affiliates to hear these announcements. In addition, we will also post

p.span: any school closings or delayed openings on our Website and contact you through our parent call system.

span.br: Student, Parent, Staff and Teacher safety will always be our objective in weather emergency related events. Should the need arise for additional action beyond the above policy; we will notify you as soon as possible.

The Eagles Nest Scholar Dollar Store, is open. Please bring your money and scholar dollars to purchase items like snacks, toys, candy, school supplies, and more! All money raised, goes directly back to our school!

span.span: Regular store hours are on Mondays-Fridays after school hours. Scholar Dollar Days are each Friday. Scholar dollars can only be distributed by DIA faculty and staff. Parents the store will not accept bills larger than a ten. Prices range for snacks range from $.10 -$2.00

h1.span: Welcome to Du Bois Integrity Academy

span.strong: ​Daily attendance is mandatory in our virtual learning platform during this time.

p.span:
Due to the school closing that DuBois Integrity Academy has experienced, we will be providing continued learning through a digital learning format. By providing the digital learning content, our students will have the opportunity to continue their learning while allowing flexibility to complete the activities during the designated break. Teachers will provide assignments via Google classroom, i-Ready, Study Island and our learning management system, for students to complete. Teachers will also be available for virtual "office hours" through Jigsaw Virtual Learning should students or parents have questions on the material or need assistance with their learning. Please look for additional email information on how to log into the Jigsaw Virtual Learning platform. Your scholar’s log-in information can be found in their DuBois Integrity Academy instructional packets that came home Friday, March 13, 2020. The packet went home Friday with your child. If your child was absent you can pick the packet up at the DIA Administrative Office on Monday & Tuesday 3/16 & 17 from 9am - 4pm.
Daily attendance is mandatory in our virtual learning platform during this time. Attendance will be verified through our online platform log in system. Parents are required to log into the following link Friday, March 20,2020, https://form.jotform.com/200702391358047

for student attendance verification. If you have any questions, require password assistance, or technical concerns please contact info@duboisintegrityacademy.com. Emails will be responded to within 24 hours. The administrative office will not be available for phone calls. Please check your email frequently during this time for additional updates and instructions.
Logging in to Google Classroom:
1. Go to classroom.google.com and click Go to Classroom.
2. Enter your student’s username and click Next.
3. Enter your student’s password and click Next.
4. If there is a welcome message, read it and click Accept.
5. Click to get

span.span: : Clayton County Public Schools in providing breakfast and lunch meals for all DIA Scholars during this coronavirus crisis. Click here for locations

strong.span: for students for the remainder of the school year
as the state and nation continue efforts to slow the spread of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) - Virtual Learning is in place.

span.span: It's A Great Day To Learn The Du Bois Way - A Choice Education - Established 2014 Clayton County, GA

Du Bois Integrity Academy takes a whole-child approach to elementary education. Teachers, administrators, counselors, and support staff work together to meet the intellectual, social, behavioral, and emotional needs of each and every child we serve.

strong.span: A Few Updates from the Principal

p.span:
Greetings DuBois Integrity Academy Parents and Families,
First, I hope everyone had a much-needed restful Spring break. As we embark upon the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, I want to encourage you to stay the course, keep the faith and let’s finish strong!
Secondly, I’m sure that everyone knows that Governor Kemp has closed all k-12 schools which means that we will not be able to provide instruction at our physical locations for the remainder of the school year. Please know that the DuBois Integrity Academy administration and governance board has elected to continue our school year up until the last scheduled day set and approved by the state of Georgia and our governance board.

em.strong: Our last day of school will be Wednesday, May 20, 2020.

p.span:
With that said, parents, we need your continued support and commitment to making sure our scholars are logging on daily and are staying actively engaged with their virtual classroom instruction. We would much rather have our scholars in the building with us and our parents working; however, we all have been dealt a hand that none of us asked for nor can we control. We want to provide our scholars with the best instruction we can give them virtually. A few final concerns regarding our virtual classroom protocol, parents we need our students, parents and other family members who may come in view of the cameras during virtual class time to, please, please make sure everyone is appropriately dressed. Parents, this is very important. We have had some very inappropriate attire exposed on the cameras for ALL students and teachers to see. Please have students seated at a desk or table with minimal distractions and please do not allow our scholars to lay in bed during class time.
Next, our goal for the remainder of this very trying year is to continue to close the academic gaps and prepare our scholars to be successful for the next grade level. Please make sure you continue to complete the JOT attendance form at the end of each week and make sure your scholars are completing all Google and virtual assignments. Our teachers will continue to grade all assignments to calculate final grades.
Finally, please make sure we have your correct mailing address on file as we will mail all the final report cards home. In addition, we are working to prepare a virtual graduation for our Kindergarten and Fifth grade classes. We do not want our scholars to completely miss these special milestone events. Both graduations will occur on the scheduled dates set on our 2019-20 school calendar.

span.strong: The kindergarteners are scheduled for Monday, May 18, 2020
5th graders will be on Wednesday, May 20, 2020.

p.span:
We are also trying to get the graduation photos for each class from Life Touch photography. More information regarding these special events will be sent to your email.
We are continuing to pray for all of our scholars and family’s health and safety. We send our condolences to anyone who has lost a love one during this Coronavirus crisis and we look forward to the return of all our DIA scholars and families.
1. Remember to stay safe by staying home unless you are going out for essential needs only.
2. Wear gloves and mask when out in public places.
3. Wash hands and disinfect commonly touched areas in your home.
4. Practice social distancing
Sincerely,
Dr. Stephanie Payne, Principal
The Governance Board meets the third Tuesday of every month September - July. All are welcome. ​ (No meeting in August)
